question: Question_02_(b)
statement:
\textbf{Short-Answer Questions}. Questions 1-4 are short-answer
questions. Put your answers in the boxes provided. \textbf{Simplify your
answers as much as possible, and show your work}. Each question is worth
3 marks, but not all questions are of equal difficulty.

Find the slope of the tangent line to the curve
$\displaystyle y + x\cos y = \cos x$ at the point $(0,1)$.
hints: Recall the relationship between slopes of tangent lines and derivatives.

Implicitly differentiate with respect to \emph{x} and then plug in
$(0,1)$. Solve for $y'$ to get the slope since the derivative at a point
is equal to the slope of the tangent line to the curve at that point.
